Package com.taco.suit_lady.util.tools

Class StringTools

java.lang.Object
com.taco.suit_lady.util.tools.SLStrings
public class StringTools extends Object
Contains methods related to manipulating strings.

      public String kmb​(double number, boolean upperCase)

      Returns:

      See Also:
      kmb(long, boolean)

    • kmb

      public String kmb​(long number, boolean upperCase)
      Formats a number to be in KMB format.

      KMB format is as follows:

      • Any number between 0 and 999 is represented as such.
      • Any number between 1000 and 999999 is represented with a 'k' replacing the last trailing digit of the number. e.g. 52250 would be represented as 52.25k.
      • Any number between 1000000 and 999999999 is represented with a 'm' replacing the last four trailing digits of the number. e.g. 1220000 would be represented as 1.22m.
      • Any number above 1000000000 is represented with a 'b' replacing the last seven trailing digits of the number. e.e. 1220000000 would be represented as 1.22b

      All negative numbers are treated the same as positive numbers.

      Parameters:
      number - The number.
      upperCase - True to display the string in upper case, false for lower case.
      Returns:
      A KMB formatted string representing the number.

    • timeFormat

      public String timeFormat​(long milliseconds)
      Formats a number to be in a readable time format. The number inputted should be in milliseconds.

      The format returned is DD:HH:MM:SS. Milliseconds are truncated and not included in the formatted display.

      All negative numbers are treated the same as positive numbers.

      Parameters:
      milliseconds - The time being formatted, in milliseconds.
      Returns:
      A KMB formatted string representing the number.

    • msToString

      public String msToString​(long ms)
      Formats the specified amount of time in milliseconds to a readable format.
      Parameters:
      ms - The amount of time in milliseconds.
      Returns:
      A formatted, readable copy of the time specified.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      A formatted, readable copy of the time specified.

      public String replace​(String host, String replaceWith, boolean useRegex, String... toReplaceValues)
      Replaces all instances of all values in the specified toReplaceValues array in the specified {code host String} with the specified replaceWith String. //TODO - Provide example.

      toReplaceValues - The array of Strings representing the values that are to be replaced with the specified {code replaceWith String}.
      Returns:

    • matches

      public boolean matches​(String string1, String string2)
      Checks to see if the first string matchesEither the second string.

      For the strings to match, the second string must be contained within the first string.

      This method is not case sensitive.

      Parameters:
      string1 - The first string being compared.
      string2 - The second string being compared.
      Returns:
      True if the first string matchesEither the second string, false otherwise. If either string is null, this method returns false.

    • matchesEither

      public boolean matchesEither​(String string1, String string2)
      Checks to see if the first string matchesEither the second string.

      For the strings to match, only one of the strings must be contained within the other.

      This method is not case sensitive.

      Parameters:
      string1 - The first string being compared.
      string2 - The second string being compared.
      Returns:
      True if the first string matchesEither the second string, false otherwise. If either string is null, this method returns false.

    • html

      public String html​(String string, boolean stripEditable)
      Converts the specified string into the default HTML format.
      Parameters:
      string - The string.
      stripEditable - True if the specified string should be made to be not editable, false if it should be left as-is.
      Returns:
      The specified string converted into the default HTML format.

    • htmlList

      public String htmlList​(boolean alwaysList, String... components)
      Returns the specified array of text as an html list.

      This method can never return null. If the specified array is null, an empty string is returned.

      Parameters:
      alwaysList - True if the data should always be shown in a list form, false if it should be shown plain if there is only 1 element.
      If this value is set to false and there is only one element in the specified array, the returned text will be surrounded in break statements (<br>)
      components - The text being converted into an html list.
      Returns:
      The specified array of text as an html list.

    • htmlStripEditable

      public String htmlStripEditable​(String string)
      Strips all HTML from the specified string that makes the string editable.
      Parameters:
      string - The string.
      Returns:
      The specified string with all HTML that makes the string editable stripped from it.

    • clearSB

      public StringBuilder clearSB​(StringBuilder stringBuilder)
      Deletes all elements contained within the specified StringBuilder.

      Calling this method is equivalent to calling stringBuilder.delete(0, stringBuilder.capacity().

      Parameters:
      stringBuilder - The StringBuilder that is being cleared.
      Returns:
      The recently cleared StringBuilder.
      See Also:
      StringBuilder.delete(int, int)

    • toString

      public String toString​(Object obj)

      Returns an appropriate toString for the specified Object.

      • If the object param is null, null is returned.
      • If the object param is an Array, the class name of the array is returned.
        ( See Collections.singletonList(Object) )
      • If the object param is an instance of Nameable, the name of the object param is returned.
      Parameters:
      obj - The Object being toString'd.
      Returns:
      An appropriate toString for the specified Object.
